turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: I'm sorry? Your face looks awfully familiar, I just can't quite place it...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Mom, this is the guy that drove us home that afternoon we were stuck on the highway. The guy you yelled at for no good reason...

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Oh, yeah.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Jackie, go play in the snow.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Just do it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Come on, mom. Don't fall asleep...

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You two ok?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Our car won't start.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Your mom take anything before this happened?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah, but I don't know what.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] What's your name?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Jackie.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: But I like it I guess.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Hey, can you reach the gas pedal?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You're just gonna walk?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Yeah, I'll hitch a ride or something. [Beat] Let her throw it all up before she gets back behind the wheel.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What're those?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Dog tags. [Off her blank look] They've got your name and date of birth for identification.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] In case you get lost, or can't remember who you are.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I think I can remember what's on them.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: William Starks. [Beat] Thanks.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What'd you do? Snoop all over the place? You had no right. You had no right to go through anything.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] I know it doesn't make sense. It doesn't even make sense to me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If you don't get out of my house right now, I'll call the police.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Jackie, I'm William Starks. I can prove it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What? Now you're gonna show me some kind of driver's license?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No, I don't have anything to show you. I'm here from a mental hospital.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, you belong in one.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Stop it! Stop it! JACKIE covers her ears and looks at him, pleading with her eyes. STARKS' eyes plead right back.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I'm sorry for upsetting you, [beat] but I'm not lying to you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You can't be William Starks. He's dead.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] What?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: William Starks is dead... [Beat] I've been to his grave.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] What?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: His body was found New Year's Day, 19...1993. At Alpine...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I looked it up.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I gave you my dog tags.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No, you didn't. They found William Starks' body dead in the snow.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: How'd he die?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't know. But he did die. STARKS falters under the news. JACKIE looks around, through her now blurred eyes, like she might find some help in the apartment. She settles for the BOTTLE of VODKA on the table, lowers the iron fork and takes a long heavy drink, then laughs nervously as she looks up.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I know what this is...I picked you up when I was drunk and you probably thought I'm just fucked up enough to fall for this. But the thing is I know what I'm doing when I drink. I just usually don't care. Right now, I do though. And I want you out. Now.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: It's December 25th, 1993 today.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No, it's not. [Beat] It's December 25th, 2004.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm telling you I don't care what time you think you're in. You're not William Starks. [Beat] I don't believe in many things, but I believe in death. And it doesn't give back what it takes. So whoever you are...I did a nice thing, you've made me regret it enough already, so please, just leave.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I'll leave. But look at me. Look at my face, Jackie. I'm not lying. I met you and your mother. I told you then that I'd lost my memory. [Beat] There was no one for miles around so I know you know there's no way I could have known that from a pair of dog tags you had lying around.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Please...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The Jacket. That's what they call it, right?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It was banned, you know... and it led to an investigation of Dr. Becker's mistreatment of some of his patients. That's when they found out how badly he was drugging his patients...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: But no one knew until after...

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: After I...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: [Beat] You bled to death.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't know how you got the cut to your head, but you died bleeding from it.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Do you really believe me?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't know. [Beat] I thought I was crazy after you left that day. I died. I still think I could be crazy. But then I replayed that night in my head -- the parts of it I could remember -- and it was like...I don't care if I was, or am. I haven't felt that way in a room with someone my whole life. [Beat] And when you left, all I wanted was...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: [Softly] I want to trust you. Should I trust you?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Then we need to figure out what happened to you. It's the only thing we can do.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Alpine Grove still exists. I looked it up on the net. We should go there and see if there's still anyone around who might have known what happened to you.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: If they don't take me out before then. [As an afterthought] What's the net?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I didn't kill Officer Harrison.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: How? Did they figure it out after I died?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No. They never figured it out. I did. Most murderers don't stop to help a drunk woman and her little girl on the side of the road. Not without hurting them.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I don't believe a thing she just said.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Me neither. Who was the boy she was talking about, Eugene?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I have no idea.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You think Lorenson kills you?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Maybe. I don't know. Seems more likely Becker does, but at the very least she knows how I died.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Let's see if they have an address for Becker. I also want to figure out more about the kid you helped her with.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Because that's the part I believe is true. You probably did help her somehow with the boy and Eugene's name did come up over and over again on the abstracts I pulled.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How long do we have?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They told me Becker's in Shelbourne now. I looked him up and he was listed.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What about Captain Medley? He never told them what happened to you over there. His testimony...that coward wanted them to think you were crazy.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I know. It was perfect. [Beat] Erase my sanity and you erase anything I'll ever say.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Of course it makes me mad. It makes me more than mad. Just like remembering the face of the man who killed that officer and knowing nothing more about him. But what's it gonna do for me to find them now? I can't fix everything in three days.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You've got to get yourself out of that place. They're going to kill you if you don't.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I might not be able to.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's not a prison, it's a hospital. There's got to be some way out of there and you've got to find it...

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Here, drink this. I'll get the heat going.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You're sure?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah. I called the number yesterday to make sure. Thomas Becker, retired M.D.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They're not here.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: They're not.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: [Beat, lost] No.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What? What are you thinking?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: There're no cars on this street.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe that's because this whole thing is a dream. How can you have a street with no cars on it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't know. But this isn't a dream. I'm real, and so is where we are.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Then why isn't there anyone around?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: [Beat] I don't know.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Of course he will. [Beat] What day of the week is it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's Sunday.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: They've got lives to be grateful for.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: William, you're not making sense.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] They're at Church. And I bet that's where Becker is.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That's all you got from him? That bastard helped take your life away from you.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No, he didn't.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What? How can you say that? He's the one that put you in that goddamn medieval...Jacket. He's probably the one who killed you.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: If everything hadn't happened the way it has, then I wouldn't be here right now, sitting in a car with you, touching your face.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Why are you saying that? [Beat] We don't have long, do we?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: To the hospital.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: What's happening to me? Why am I getting so much weaker?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Because your body can only take so much of what they're putting you through.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Lorenson's the only one that could let me out of there. I need something to persuade her that I was there. Get me something to take to her.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ok. Ssh. Rest.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: When we first met, when you were 7, where was the house you lived in with your mother? Do you remember your address?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: 112 Orchard Way. [Realizing, in a whisper] You're not coming back, are you?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You gotta stop thinking like that.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Then, where are you going?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Nowhere. [Beat] I just think I'm gonna be sick.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I've been ok.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Good. How's your mom?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ok, I guess.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] You be good to yourself, Jackie.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ok.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You're bleeding pretty bad there.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's ok. It's ok. Relax. It's just a cut. We can get it fixed. But we need to get you to the hospital now. How'd you get that?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I fell down. [Beat] But I'm alive.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How you doin'?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I'm doing fine.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Just a little, when we were looking up information about William's father. How did he help?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: It's complicated, but [looking at Starks] in a way, your father let me know how I'd get through to him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: He just said...that I'd shock Eugene and then things would change for him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: I still don't either, even after all these years.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Because Becker resigned after the charges brought against him by State Patient Advocacy Groups.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: I see you've done your homework. [Beat] Alpine Grove's undergone a lot of changes since then. At the time, we didn't have the...resources to help our patients the way we needed to. [Beat] Now, we do. And things are different.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: And if I didn't want to come?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: I guess I'd ask you why.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Because I don't think I'm crazy.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: You're not crazy.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: You were convicted of the crime.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: That conviction doesn't convince me of anything. Until I know that I did it, I'm not going to accept that I did.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: You may never remember at all. [Beat] Your mind's grasp of reality and the real events that have happened to you has been damaged.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No. The real events that have happened to me have been fucked up. Not my mind.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Why, what would you do?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I could try to...make it stop.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No. I don't want it to.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: So it's helping?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: You should be careful. You could be killed if they found you out here.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Believe me, I know.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: My God you look exactly like him.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I never knew my father. Did you?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: Yeah, I did. [Beat] He was my most memorable patient.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: At the end, he made me change my mind about a lot of things.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You thought my father was crazy?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: What case?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: I was working with a boy named Eugene.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: How'd he get it?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] I don't know.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: But Dr. Morgan said you were around when my father was...

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: I was. But I saw a lot of cuts and a lot of blows. I'm sorry I don't know more about your father's. [Sincerely] I didn't know about everything that went on here.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Well, do you think Dr. Becker would have any idea?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: How do you know about Dr. Becker?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: My dad wrote some things down before he died.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: So maybe Dr. Becker would know. [Beat] But, as I'm sure you know, the statute of limitations has run out for charging the hospital with any liabilities.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Why would we do that?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: It's important for you to know who your father was, isn't it?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] Yeah, it is.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: Well... [beat] let me know how your search turns out.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] We will.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: You'll die if you keep smoking those in your condition.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I'll die either way.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You have no idea what's going on.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: No, I do. That's what I'm saying to you.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Listen to me! You don't! The Jacket is my only chance in this place.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You don't understand.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: Then help me understand. You know, you're not alone. A lot of Gulf Vets have begun to experience curious symptoms. What you have might well be a syndrome and, if so, it's not one we know enough about to be treating it this vigorously.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: This has nothing to do with that.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I don't know. [Frustrated] Remember?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Come on. Tell me what you do know.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] I've seen a time that's not this time. And I'm only able to see it when I'm in the Jacket.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: Well, what time is it?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: Ok fine. Tell me about it. Tell me about the future. 2004. What does it look like?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: It doesn't look all that different.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: The future doesn't look different?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No. Not for people like me. [Beat] Not in the places I come from.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: What about the world?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I didn't see that much of it -- same as now. I only saw it as part of my own life.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: [Beat] Like who? Like MacKenzie maybe?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: Why don't you help me?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Because I don't have time.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I'm about to die unless I do something to stop it.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: And how do you know that?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Because of the future. I know what's going to happen.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: William, that is just another facet of my delusions.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: How do you know about Eugene?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You told me about him. I saw you and I think you thought I knew something about him. So you told me.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Some part of you suspects -- even if you don't know for sure -- that what I'm saying is true.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: I don't know how you know about Eugene, but these ideas are part of your delusions.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: NO! They're not my delusions! Look, just leave my business with Becker to me!

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: I know. I know it all. Save your strength. I already know everything you're going to say. [Beat] You're in the Jacket right now, aren't you?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: How...how do you know?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: You told me this was how it happened.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Who...who kills me?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: You have nothing to fear, William.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: You're going to be ok, William. We just need to get your fever down and we'll be able to hopefully stabilize you.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Who are you kidding, Doc? You or me?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Can I get some paper and something to write with.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: I'm not gonna let that happen.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You still don't believe me, do you?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: I do believe you...

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No. Listen to me...the kid, Eugene...

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: William, I can't indulge these delusions, even when you're in this state.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Listen to me. That's all I ask.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: He's having absence [pronounced "absance"] seizures when he stares off into space like he does. He has them so often that that's why he hasn't learned to speak properly.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: Who told you this?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You did, in the future. You figured it out because a part of you already knows this. That's how it works. [Beat] I'm just telling you something you already know, even if you haven't realized it.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I don't know when it'll happen but soon I think, you'll shock the boy and it'll wake him up.

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You'll figure it out and you'll do good by him.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: You know how to get there?

turns.speaker: LORENSON
turns.text: Sure. It's an easy address. A little far out there, but easy enough.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: That's Kingsley. Old bastard hears us, I'm sure. He just doesn't want to bother answering so he makes us think he can't talk. I know. I tried it on my mother for two months once before she fished out my tongue. Literally. [Beat] You're the cop killer, right?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Yeah, guess so. How'd you know?

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: TV. Helps numb [makes a "crazy gesture"] any active mind. [Sticking out a jittery hand] Rudy MacKenzie.

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: I tried to kill my wife.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Don't you go to jail for that?

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: I tried something like 30 times. There is, as STARKS rightly figures, no suitable response to that.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Yeah, well 30 times probably would make you seem crazy.

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: Or just plain stupid. You'd think by the twentieth time, I'd have found an alternative method. Maybe a more effective one, if you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: What were you talking about the other day?

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: I wasn't talking about anything.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Yeah, you were. What you said about them taking me out to the woods...

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: I know you need one when it's really cold.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Cutting in] MacKenzie, listen to me. Listen. I'm going to die.

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: Mortality's actually a great thing to be familiar with. It means you're sane on some level.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Gravely] No, I mean in four days, I'm supposed to die.

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: [Beat] How do you know?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: The Jacket.

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: Oh no, you're pretty young. Your body'll be able to handle a lot more of it than you think...

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No. [Beat] I mean I found out while I was in it that my body's gonna be found in four days.

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: It's gonna be sticky.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: 'Cause Lorenson's got her claws in it now. When she started getting suspicious about me was when they stopped using it on me. Women!

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: So what am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: You could still always give Becker an itch. 'Course you might get killed when he goes to scratch it, but seems to me you're saying that's about to happen anyway. [Beat] Just be careful not to walk yourself right into something.

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: Geez, how's that for a fucking "thank you"?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Is it true?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: MacKenzie, [beat] what if we are crazy?

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: [Shrugging] What if we are? There're crazier things than thinking up fictions for yourself. [Beat] Everyone does it, don't they? Even Becker. That roller coaster car pops more pills than all of Ward 3.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Becker does? Are you sure?

turns.speaker: MACKENZIE
turns.text: I've been here for 11 years. It's my neighborhood. 'Course I'm sure. He's as drugged up as the rest of us...I guess he has to be to put up with all this.

turns.speaker: TENNY
turns.text: You ever been to jail?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TENNY
turns.text: It's worse than war. It's worse than anywhere you've ever been.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I doubt it. [Beat] I don't think prison's so bad you don't want to remember it...

turns.speaker: TENNY
turns.text: Hey, Mister, you need a ride?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: TENNY
turns.text: I'm going to Canada but I can let you ride with me up to the border.

turns.speaker: TENNY
turns.text: Can you drive?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: TENNY
turns.text: Great, get in. We'll switch off in a bit.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: If you're deaf, read my lips...I don't need a psycho following me today.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] I'm not deaf.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: In case you hadn't figured, it's Christmas Eve. You're never gonna get a cab here.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] Thanks.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: All right. [Beat] You got somewhere you need to go, Mister?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Let me ask you that again. This time, look around and consider your options.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: You don't have anywhere to stay?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Well, where are you from?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I'm not sure. [Beat] I don't really know.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Of course you don't know.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Why "of course"?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Because in my life, it wouldn't make sense for me to pick up some normal guy with a place where he's from and a place where he's going to. It'd be too simple. I probably wouldn't know how to handle a situation like that.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Well, you definitely didn't pick normal or simple this time either.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Well, how'd you get here?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] I was dropped off.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Do you have a motel or something? Money?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Well, don't you somewhere? Stuff? Belongings?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No. [Beat] Not around here.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Great. That was our last option. What am I going to do with you?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: Nothing. [Getting up] Thanks for bringing me this far.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Where are you going? You'll freeze out there. You don't even have a coat.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I'll manage.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: No, you won't. You'll die of cold out there and then I'll have to feel guilty. And I've already got more guilt than I know what to do with. [Beat] Do you want something to drink?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: No, I'm ok.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: [Beat] Yeah, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: You know what? It's Christmas Eve. And you look clean -- I mean, you're normal-looking. [Resolutely, for her own benefit] It's Christmas Eve, and I have a couch.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: The best I could do with what was in your fridge.

turns.speaker: STARKS
turns.text: I only lit it because it was so cold in here. I'm sorry if...

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: No, it's fine. [Beat, swallow] Thanks.
